item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 8, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: A portable hash map in C (28 points | 9 comments)
2. UK bans daytime TV ads for cereals, muffins and burgers (74 points | 43 comments)
3. Mise: Dev tools, env vars, task runner (150 points | 86 comments)
4. How much do I need to change my face to avoid facial recognition? (66 points | 53 comments)
5. Insects rely on sounds made by distressed vegetation to guide reproduction (149 points | 111 comments)
6. Researchers use AI to turn sound recordings into street images (101 points | 37 comments)
7. Chuck E. Cheese's animatronics band bows out (21 points | 6 comments)
8. Qutebrowser: A keyboard-driven, Vim-like browser (80 points | 35 comments)
9. SQLite changed temp file prefix after McAfee users called devs to complain (2006) (120 points | 31 comments)
10. Small AI Chip Maker Marvell Now More Valuable Than Intel (50 points | 23 comments)
11. Nyxt: The Hacker's Browser (404 points | 199 comments)
12. Reverse engineering the Sega Channel game image file format (215 points | 40 comments)
13. Zizmor would have caught the Ultralytics workflow vulnerability (51 points | 13 comments)
14. The Need to Grind Concrete Examples Before Jumping Up a Level of Abstraction (120 points | 42 comments)
15. Codenames App, or my biggest project so far (45 points | 8 comments)
16. Mend it Mark gets suspect copyright strike for £25k audio amp repair (184 points | 66 comments)
17. Ask HN: What are the best programmable holiday lights? (103 points | 51 comments)
18. Show HN: Cut the crap – remove AI bullshit from websites (153 points | 97 comments)
19. Linux EFI Zboot Abandoning "Compression Library Museum", Focusing on Gzip, ZSTD (33 points | 5 comments)
20. How do I pay the publisher of a web page? (45 points | 74 comments)
21. Flappy Bird in 1000 lines of C (111 points | 40 comments)
22. "BGP at home": getting a DIA circuit installed at home (193 points | 48 comments)
23. SP1: A performant, 100% open-source, contributor-friendly zkVM (53 points | 22 comments)
24. The Surreal Magnificence of Fatherhood (103 points | 120 comments)
25. Arthur Cravan: The Disappearing Dadaist (22 points | 1 comment)
26. China completes green belt around Taklamakan Desert (133 points | 100 comments)
27. Scratch and Sniff Stickers and the Gas Panic of '87 (39 points | 2 comments)
28. Show HN: SQL Simulator – Create Subsetted Databases in Docker or K8s (29 points | 3 comments)
29. Make a "Magic Eye" image using Excel (80 points | 37 comments)
30. Taxpayers spend 22% more per patient to support Medicare Advantage (77 points | 55 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 8, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
